critique: The document is a formal executive order amending a previous order to remove gender-specific terms from the Code of Conduct for members of the Armed Forces. The language is formal and legalistic. The primary emotions conveyed are related to duty, patriotism, and resolve. There is a sense of seriousness and commitment to the defense of the country and its values. Joy is low, as it is a formal document. Sadness is low, as it is a proactive measure. Fear is moderate, related to the context of combat and captivity. Disgust is low. Surprise is low, as it is an amendment to an existing order.
